content.webTitle: Man critically injured and 12 arrested after 100-person Melbourne brawl

fields.headline: Man critically injured and 12 arrested after 100-person Melbourne brawl
fields.bodyText: Twelve men have been arrested and one man left with life-threatening injuries after 100 people joined in a brawl in the Melbourne suburb of Seaford. The ruckus started about 5.35pm on Sunday at Wells Road outside Kananook railway station in Seaford, just north of the bayside suburb of Frankston. A 23-year-old Seaford man received multiple stab wounds to his abdomen during the fight. He was taken to Frankston hospital by a group of unknown men and remained in a critical condition on Monday. Victoria police said 12 men, aged between 19 and 32 and hailing from various Melbourne suburbs, were arrested following the brawl and taken to the Frankston and Mornington police stations. As of Monday morning, all 12 remained in custody but none had been charged. Police seized baseball bats, a samurai sword and a machete from three vehicles searched as part of their investigation, they said. Police have asked anyone who witnessed the brawl to contact them.
